page.title: 17The School Cook
page.content: I started as a canteen helper in 1951.The lunch was sent from Winslow in a heated container;meat and two vegetables or fish,ham and bacon flan, jam tart,bread pudding,sponge and custard or rice.I washed up in one bowl and rinsed in another.The water was heated in an electric boiler which I filled each day from a tap in the cloakroom which is now the cleaner's store cupboard. When a kitchen was built in 1965 I became a cook\caterer.There is an electrically driven oil stove with two ovens and one heating cupboard and it heats the water;one big sink;one sterilizer;an electric fryer;a food mixer and a refrigerator.Tea towels and cloths are boiled each day in a pan. I work for 27.5 hours a week.22 children have dinner now;it was 36 in 1951 and 83 in 1965.
